channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Trump wraps up state visit to U.K.
item.description: After a day of royal pomp, President Trump's visit to the United Kingdom closes with a business reception and a meeting with Prime Minister Keir Starmer.

item.title: Former CDC director says she was fired for resisting pressure from RFK Jr.
item.description: Susan Monarez, the ousted director of the CDC, testified on Capitol Hill Wednesday that the health secretary pressured her to rubber stamp vaccine policies without reviewing scientific evidence.

item.title: Former CDC leader shares why she decided to leave
item.description: NPR speaks with Debra Houry, the CDC's former chief medical officer, about her decision to leave her post and her concerns over Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s vaccine decisions.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: An advisory committee meets Thursday to recommend vaccine policies, the Fed lowers interest rates for the first time this year, ABC takes Jimmy Kimmel off air for comments on Charlie Kirk's killing.

item.title: Oliver Darcy talks about ABC's decision to take Jimmy Kimmel off air
item.description: Oliver Darcy, author of Status, a nightly newsletter about the corridors of media power, explains ABC's decision to take Jimmy Kimmel off air following his comments on the killing of Charlie Kirk.

item.title: UC Berkeley professor warns of 'unprecedented crackdown' on academic freedom
item.description: UC Berkeley told 160 faculty, staff and students that their names were included in files shared with the federal government related to "alleged antisemitic incidents." We hear from one of them.

item.title: Facing Trump's pressure, the Federal Reserve cuts rates for the first time this year
item.description: The Federal Reserve lowered its benchmark interest rate for the first time this year, but President Trump is demanding bigger rate cuts.

item.title: What effect will the Fed's interest rates cut have and what could happen next
item.description: NPR talks with Stacey Vanek Smith, a reporter at Bloomberg, about the effect the Federal Reserve's decision to cut interest rates could have.

item.title: 'Why Fascists Fear Teachers' explores how attacks on education undermine democracy
item.description: Randi Weingarten, president of the American Federation of Teachers, talks about her new book "Why Fascists Fear Teachers."

item.title: Trump to meet with prime minister as he wraps his state visit in the U.K.
item.description: After a day of royal pomp, President Trump's visit to the United Kingdom wraps up Thursday with a business reception and a meeting with Prime Minister Keir Starmer.
